Posts.Content: Hi Ronstar I hope it's easier for you tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: Just some letting off steam after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi LondonLass, could you get a phone number for your breast surgeon's secretary to ask him why you have been sent a letter for a mammogram when he said he wouldn't need to see you until June.   Sorry can't think of anything else. xx
Posts.Title: Who would you contact?

Posts.Content: I agree with Rainbow if it's worrying ask.  Will be thinking about you tomorrow. xxx
Posts.Title: Now I know.....

Posts.Content: Just wanted to say you are an inspiration. Sending lots of hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Now I know.....

Posts.Content: Brilliant news!!! xx
Posts.Title: The neoadjuvant chemo is working.

Posts.Content: Signed
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi Wombat.123 I was sent for a mammogram last November 2015 as I had found a lump in right breast, have had quite a few problems with this breast in the last few years cysts and lumps and always been sent for mammograms as I have a form of leukaemia. Was told nothing to worry about you just have a lumpy breast. Fast forward September 2016 (being nosy) I missed a step and fell down, a couple of weeks later felt a painful lump in different area of breast, back for another mammogram expecting to be told just another lump, but no told it's breast cancer and apparently when they re-checked the November mammogram as I asked was it there then it turns out there was a shadow in that area then and I should have been recalled for further tests but wasn't.  I know I can't change the outcome now and need to focus on the here and now but keep thinking I should have noticed the lump earlier.
Posts.Title: Was this the start?

Posts.Content: Hi, I know what you mean about the waiting, when I got my results last week I thought a treatment plan would be soon put in place but I've got to have a cavity shave operation? (which I have convinced myself means that some of the cancer is still there) then after I've waited for those results, they will then send off the Oncotype test. I know this is all for my own good but the waiting is awful.
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Have a lovely day  xxx
Posts.Title: Advice on Pain Relief...

Posts.Content: Good news, that will be another one down xx
Posts.Title: All clear for the second FEC-T tomorrow.

Posts.Content: Hi Glasgow I have had the test. My oncologist said with my pathology results previously I would have gone straight to chemo but as you say there is now the Oncotype DX test. My score came back 29 and I am now having chemo, as my unit has a cut off point in the intermediate range and I've decided to go with chemo. I'm sorry I've no words of advice for you but I do understand your situation as I was worried about what score would come back, it is a difficult decision to make xx
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: Great news, have a fab Christmas and New Year xx
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: Hi Jane could you contact your BC Nurse and ask her or someone from your team to explain what it means. I don't think they understand how worrying things are to us as we don't have their understanding of how cancer works. You could also try the Macmillan helpline to see if they can advise you.
Posts.Title: Worried about pathology report

Posts.Content: Hi Jane, I understand how you feel, they tell us things and say don't worry but don't seem to realise we do worry because we don't have their understanding of the disease, all we want is to be rid of it completely. I hope your surgeon gets back to you. I did speak to another BCN when mine was on leave perhaps another one can help.
Posts.Title: Worried about pathology report

Posts.Content: Hello JMC04 I know I was devastated, I tried everything to get over it, I've never took so many concoctions lol and the worst thing was I felt better on Friday!!!  It's good your getting away, the sitting and waiting is awful. It's weird isn't it that we can't wait to have an operation.  I only started using the forum recently but have rung the helpline a few times and they have been brilliant. If you are concerned about anything I would definitely recommend ringing the helpline plus use your breast care nurse. I understand what your husband means it feels like for the time being we are in a new normal. Wishing you all the best for next week and your operation on Monday. I'll be thinking of you. xxx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley  It came as such a shock, out of all the scenarios I pictured when I went to get my results, another operation never even entered my head. I must admit I feel more concerned about this operation than I did about my lumpectomy and SNB. I have been wondering if they are going to find more. It's the waiting for the results which I find trying. It did feel like they gave me what good news they could first before they then dropped the news about a second operation.  Up to now it feels like every time I've been to the hospital it's been mixed news. I really do want to get off this roller coaster soon. I'm so glad everything is well with you. Thank you for your post it has made me feel less anxious. I have been worrying about the delay in having the op and what it would mean. xxx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Hello, JMC04 I know what you mean about waking up in the early hours of the morning everything seems so much worse and your mind is in a whirl.  Also I was the same as you I have had a few mammograms over the last couple of years and they have always either been cysts or lumps so it came as quite a shock when I was told it was cancer in September. I had a lumpectomy in October but unfortunately they didn't get clear margins so I'm having to go back in for another operation, hopefully this Friday, as I had to cancel the one last Friday due to having cold but unfortunately my partner has come down with cold today, so fingers crossed I won't catch, but it's causing me sleepless nights, thinking the cancer has has spread.  We also had a holiday that we had to cancel. Good luck with your pre-op tomorrow but it's nothing to worry about. Daisy10 xxx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Merry Christmas everyone xxx
Posts.Title: Xmas

Posts.Content: I did suffer with nausea and have now got different anti - sickness tablets which will hopefully work better if it happens again, but apart from that I feel OK even with a chest infection. xxx
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi AmeLou I had the Oncotype test my score came back 29 which is high intermediate, my hospital has a cut off score of 25 for starting chemo in the high intermediate range..  I started my chemo treatment last week.
Posts.Title: To have or not to have Chemo
